topic.title: Backing Up Greenplum Databases
topic.shortdesc: This topic describes backup options for Greenplum Databases.

body.p: You can use different methods to back up your Greenplum databases, depending on the purpose of the backup. Every production database should have in place a backup strategy to ensure that the database can be restored in case of disaster. Routine backups should use a method that takes advantage of Greenplum parallelism, for example the gpcrondump utility.
You can also use a third-party backup solution, such as Dell EMC Data Domain Boost or Veritas NetBackup with gpcrondump to backup and restore Greenplum Database.

Backups can be used for purposes other than disaster recovery, such as migrating data from one Greenplum database to another Greenplum database, or migrating a database to or from a different database system. These may be one-time tasks or part of your regular business process. Depending on requirements, you can use tools such as the standard PostgreSQL backup utilities, the gptransfer utility, or the SQL COPY TO command.
